page.title: 06TWON MAYORS 2
page.content:
The town mayor's duties consist of presiding over council meetings and representing the town on such occasions as the carnival and the festival.The mayor does not have a chauffeur driven car,but usually does not travel far as his duties are generally confined to the town or local area. The mayor does not receive an annual salary,but as help,the mayor has the aid of a deputy mayor and a mayoress. There has been a mayor in Tewkesbury since 1836,when a new charter by William III succeeded one by James II.
(cont.)
